channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
Not unrelated to the question of regulating of social media giants, I just had a very unpleasant experience with @instagram. https://t.co/HhCsYaXWXb
@instagram I've made perhaps half a dozen posts on IG; I guess none in the past 30 days, if Meta, a company that has lied to Congress and the courts, is telling the truth.
I've received no notices from IG on what pieces of their Terms of Service I am accused of violating, which is why I did not appeal in the putative 30 days.
However: If I were to tell an unhappy client or vendor that I was no longer dealing with them, because they had violated the contract, but I refused to say how -- well, that would be problematic.
@rmneiss @kampeas Agudah has fewer funders who are major Republican activists. I'm pretty sure Bernie Marcus, who helped launch the now neo-Nazi TP*SA, is a major federation guy.
@Howard_Lovy If this book has a strong focus on the Newark piece of the fight, I might be interested in writing about it for the New Jersey Jewish News.

We need to talk more about why gun proliferation is Republican dogma. And how the Buffalo white supremacist terror attack is a feature, not a bug, in their Second Anendment jurisprudence. https://t.co/wN3dErW4Ps

@Plutor @rob_sheridan @RottenInDenmark Yes. They have assignment editors, who want these articles and probably mostly agree with them. And they have copy editors, who may well be rolling their eyes as they smooth out the prose and add the hyperlinks.

@trekonomics You know, if I’m an advertiser, I want to know number of users accessing tweets directly, through the app or the web, not via tweetdeck or the API.
@trekonomics The fact that figure is apparently not footnoted in SEC filings speaks to Twitter’s failures in the advertising business.
Today in scions of Young Israel. https://t.co/KOrI54b3BM
@Mostofsky On what basis are you saying this? Asking sincerely.

@WbtphdjdTurner @roeeorland @West_Looper @mmasnick @ataxiwardance Constitutional is what Alito says is constitutional. The current SCOTUS has explicitly and implicitly renounced the idea of precedent.
@WbtphdjdTurner @roeeorland @West_Looper @mmasnick @ataxiwardance My guess is that the law will be overturned, and that SCOTUS will issue a stay, but either on federalism grounds (regulating interstate commerce) or groundlessly on the Shadow Docket.

@Shmarya @jh_swanson So like US cops. The point is not to enforce the law; the point is to enforce the power disparity.
@Shmarya @jh_swanson That’s why they let crime run rampant in the Arab sector, while attacking legal Palestinian political expression.
@dougdaulton @egavactip It’s not beyond what Roddenberry would have written, but it’s more than NBC would have allowed.
@Shmarya @jh_swanson I just wrote a note to myself to make some calls on Monday.
@Shmarya @jh_swanson https://t.co/JeRPmpfFkT
@johnpavlovitz They’ve been re-educated. Listen to three hours of propaganda daily, how could you not be convinced? It’s not like the other side is offering a counter argument.
@jh_swanson @Shmarya We had an antisemitic attack here because of that theory.

Fact check: True. The US is the eighth leading banana exporter. (Link in next tweet.) https://t.co/t9tFq857ub
Trailing Belgium and Netherlands, that actually have functional governments. https://t.co/lpK7z4hXaR

@Seggitorial @trekonomics Note that AIPAC does not consider spreading the Great Replacement Theory a deal-breaker when they donate to candidates. Unlike being a traitor to the Republican Party Line; they wouldn’t donate to staunchly pro-Israel Lynn Cheney until they were embarrassed by the public outcry.
@Seggitorial @trekonomics A few thousand Jewish Bernie supporters dropped into the Pacific Ocean is a small price to pay to protect low capital gains rates, ammirite?
@ggreeneva @Atrios You know what you call someone who partners with Nazis, refuses to call out the Nazi party by name, and is afraid to fight the Nazis or to earn their ire?

@datadivajf I need to review my Star Trek Blueprints but this does strain belief.
@datadivajf But maybe the reason the Enterprise had a smaller crew in The Cage than it did later on was because they had bigger rooms???
Spoiler: No. https://t.co/3fZmqFi6pQ
TFW a thread you meant to schedule for 12:40 pm starts spoiling in the middle of the night…..
@BlueNWildRose Good! The better to review your galleys!
@EladNehorai Say what you want about equating advocates of the Great Replacement Theory and advocates of BDS, but AIPAC is happy to give money to the former.
@donmoyn Maybe she’s praying that they don’t riot at the victims’ funerals.

@SergioVengeance @KenPaxtonTX Pretty clear the Alito Court is playing Calvinball, not jurisprudence. Though I suspect the desire not to break up the US now that they’ve gained control of it will lead SCOTUS to overturn on federalism grounds.
@SergioVengeance @KenPaxtonTX The Party line now is that corporations are abusing their speech, so Alito will probably punt on the First Amendment issue to scare the corporations.
